decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive artifact creatures and disruptive artifacts like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb for accelerated mana, the deck can deploy threats quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Fleetwheel Cruiser and Walking Ballista provide additional pressure, while cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Chalice of the Void disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to establish board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful counterspells, disruption, and card advantage. The deck aims to restrict the opponent's resources by playing Standstill, while also efficiently dealing with threats using removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. With a blend of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and countermagic like Mana Drain and Force of Will, the deck seeks to outvalue opponents and grind out victories by maintaining a resource advantage. The inclusion of restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk further enhances the deck's power level.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game using Oath of Druids to rapidly put powerful creatures into play, such as Griselbrand, Emrakul, and Inferno Titan. The deck includes a variety of counterspells, card advantage tools, and versatile spells like Show and Tell to disrupt the opponent's game plan and dominate the battlefield. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden provide additional ways to control the game and outmaneuver the opponent. This deck aims to quickly establish dominance and overwhelm the opponent with unstoppable threats.

This combo deck aims to generate a large amount of mana and card advantage through fast mana artifacts and spells like Paradoxical Outcome. The key cards in the deck include Voltaic Key, Time Vault, and Tolarian Academy to create infinite turns and draw cards to assemble the win conditions. Additionally, the deck runs a suite of powerful blue counter spells and card draw spells to protect the combo and dig for key pieces. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and powerful threats like Sphinx of the Steel Wind and Monastery Mentor.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing powerful and efficient spells and card draw to maintain control of the game while rapidly applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The deck includes a mix of countermagic, card advantage, and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also using Moxen and other fast mana sources to ramp into threats quickly. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden provides additional value and versatility, making it a well-rounded and adaptable aggro deck.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with Dredge creatures through cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Golgari Grave-Troll, allowing for a powerful combo with cards like Dread Return and Bridge from Below. The deck also includes cards like Leyline of the Void to disrupt opponent strategies and Cabal Therapy for disruption and graveyard manipulation. By utilizing the graveyard effectively, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of strong creatures and graveyard recursion.

The deck focuses on using powerful control spells like Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Snapcaster Mage to disrupt the opponent while generating card advantage with cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The inclusion of artifact mana accelerants like Black Lotus and Moxen allows for quick and efficient casting of powerful threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden. The deck also includes a Time Vault combo with Voltaic Key, providing an alternate win condition. Overall, the deck is designed to control the game through powerful spells and card advantage.

This deck revolves around using Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It also includes various control elements such as counterspells and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the game until it can safely resolve an Oath trigger to bring out a game-winning creature. It utilizes a combination of powerful spells and mana acceleration in the form of Moxen and other mana rocks to quickly establish control and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's plays with counterspells and removal spells, while also having the ability to generate value through Snapcaster Mage and card draw spells like Brainstorm and Preordain. The deck can also threaten to win the game quickly with the Splinter Twin combo, creating infinite token creatures with Deceiver Exarch. Additionally, the deck has versatile tools like Dack Fayden and Venser, Shaper Savant to deal with a variety of threats and situations on the battlefield.
